**Manufacturing Company Growing in Arlington, TX - Amazing Benefits + 401k match + More!**  
  
This Jobot Job is hosted by: Caitlyn Hardy  
Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.  
Salary: $110,000 - $130,000 per year  
  
**A bit about us:**

  
  
We are a manufacturing company that makes rubbers and metals for the oil, gas, and aerospace industry. Currently we are seeking a Quality Manager to join our team.   
  
We are currently seeking a dynamic, detail-oriented, and experienced Quality Manager to join our team. Our ideal candidate has a strong background in the oil and gas industry, rubber manufacturing industry, metal industry, and molded products. The role demands a deep understanding of welding, coating, and machining processes. This is a fantastic opportunity for a professional with a proven track record in maintaining quality standards, who is ready to take their career to the next level in a fast-paced, challenging, and rewarding environment.  
  
**Why join us?**

  
* Excellent medical, dental, and vision benefits
* Upward mobility
* Bonus
* Competitive Salary
* 401k with match

  
+ More!  
  
**Job Details**

  
  
Responsibilities:  
  
* Develop, implement, communicate and maintain a quality plan to bring the Company’s Quality Systems and Policies into compliance with quality system requirements.
* Effectively interact with Production and Development teams to maintain product supply and help introduce new products.
* Working with purchasing staff to establish quality requirements from external suppliers.
* Setting QA compliance objectives and ensuring that targets are achieved.
* Assessing the product specifications of the company and its suppliers, and comparing with customer requirements.
* Working with operating staff to establish procedures, standards, systems and procedures.
* Writing management and technical reports and customers’ charters.
* Determining relevant quality associated training needs and delivering training.
* Collating and analyzing performance data against defined parameters.
* Ensuring tests and procedures are properly understood, carried out and evaluated and that product modifications are investigated if necessary.
* Supervising technical staff in carrying out tests and checks, often in a laboratory environment.
* Bringing together staff of different disciplines and driving the group to plan, formulate and agree on comprehensive quality procedures.
* Persuading reluctant staff to change their way of working to incorporate quality methods.
* Directing objectives to maximize profitability.
* Recording, analyzing and distributing statistical information.
* Monitoring performance through gathering relevant data and producing statistical reports.
* Making suggestions for changes and improvements and how to implement them.

  
Qualifications:  
  
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Quality Assurance or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar role within the Energy industry.
* Strong knowledge of ISO 9001, CQI, and other relevant quality control standards.
* Experience in the oil and gas industry, rubber manufacturing industry, metal industry, and molded products.
* Proficiency in welding, coating, and machining processes.
* Excellent communication, leadership, and project management skills.
* Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
* Strong understanding of customer and market dynamics and requirements.
* Ability to travel as required.
* Certified Quality Engineer (CQE), Certified Six Sigma Black Belt (CSSBB), or similar certification is a plus.

title: Embedded Systems Software Engineer
description:
We are seeking an Embedded Systems Software Engineer to work collaboratively within our team of engineers to design, develop and maintain products and test system functionality.

**Responsibilities:**

* Assist in design, development, and maintenance of embedded software using RTOS (Real-Time Operating system) which is used for data acquisition, evaluation, and display systems for the Aerospace Industry
* Coordinate system/software requirements, design, and code development and maintenance
* Perform software verification and validation activities along with peer reviews of designs and software code
* Perform software/hardware and system integration
* Attend SOI audits with the FAA representatives and DER to certify the product
* Support of flight test from development through certification
* Prepare and present ideas for new/improved systems, addressing cost, schedule, and risks
* Assist in design or develop programs of use in the company’s engineering projects aligned with DO-178B & C standards
* Evaluate product demand from customer and express theoretical design to meet customer requirements
* Translate technical guidance received from supervisor into usable data applicable to a particular project
* Develop software test procedures, software programs, and related documentation
* Day to day work with different microcontrollers (STM32F4 STM32F7-ARM based controllers) setting up their memory, assigning timers, ports and other peripherals, also communication protocols (ARINC825, ARINC429, RS232, RS422, I2C, UART, SPI, MODBUS) that are independent and codependent on other system variables to interact with larger mainframe devices
* Work closely with hardware in a lab setting, and debug using lab equipment (e.g. spectrum analyzer, digital oscilloscope)
* Perform source code management and version control management (GIT, Subversion and SourceSafe)
* Perform additional duties as required

**Requirements:**

* Master’s Degree or Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering or related field from accredited college or University
* Three to five years of experience in engineering programming
* Expert knowledge of embedded software and firmware development, including C and C++
* Experience with aerospace applications (DO-178) is a plus
* Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle
* Knowledge in Graphical User Interface programming, preferably in C#
* Ability to read schematics and debug digital hardware using oscilloscope, logic analyzer, or similar tools for troubleshooting
* Must understand coding and OOP software design principles
* Experience parsing and assembling of packets for use over the serial data ports on a system that has RTOS
* Problem solving and analytical reasoning capabilities

We offer an excellent benefits package, including life insurance, comprehensive medical and dental plan, profit sharing and retirement plan and 401(k) plan. Salary will be commensurate with experience, education and ability.

title: Associate Software Engineer Internship
description:
**Wellfit Developer Internship: Creating Seamless Dental Plan Purchase Experiences**

**Job Type**: Internship  
**Pay**: $15.00 - $25.00 per hour  
**Expected hours**: 28 per week

  
**About the Project:**

Join us at Wellfit for an exciting opportunity to revolutionize the way patients purchase dental plans online. We are seeking a Developer Intern to create "WigitTized," a cutting-edge, embeddable JavaScript widget designed to streamline the dental plan purchase process. This widget will allow patients to effortlessly select and buy dental plans directly from various dental practice websites, offering a seamless integration of organization, practice, plan type, coverage level, and geographical location.

**Internship Goals:**

As a Developer Intern at Wellfit, you will:

* **Design and Implement an Embeddable Widget:** Create a user-friendly widget that can be easily integrated into dental practice websites, requiring minimal technical effort from the client's side.
* **Ensure Dynamic Content Delivery:** Utilize advanced JavaScript techniques to dynamically update the widget's content based on specific parameters, enhancing the user experience by providing personalized plan options.
* **Incorporate Secure Payment Solutions:** Integrate a secure and intuitive payment gateway within the widget, mirroring the convenience and reliability of services like PayPal, to facilitate hassle-free purchases.
* **Foster Real-Time Communication:** Establish a secure, real-time link between client websites and Wellfit servers to efficiently manage plan purchases and member data.
* **Simplify Installation Process:** Enable clients to independently install and configure the widget, minimizing the need for technical support.
* **Prioritize Security:** Implement stringent security measures, including CORS configurations and bearer tokens, to protect user data and transactions.

**Technical Implementation Overview:**

* **Front-End Development:** Craft the widget using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, ensuring it is both aesthetically pleasing and functionally robust.
* **Back-End Development:** Handle server-side logic using C# and interface with MS SQL Server databases for comprehensive data management.

**Who We Are Looking For:**

* Current Computer Science juniors or seniors with proficient coding skills in JavaScript, CSS, HTML, C#, and experience with MS SQL.
* Individuals passionate about creating impactful user experiences and interested in tackling challenges related to e-commerce and healthcare technology.
* Self-motivated learners eager to work in a dynamic team environment and contribute to innovative projects.

**Why Join Wellfit?**

This internship presents a unique opportunity to directly impact the healthcare technology sector by improving access to dental care. You will gain hands-on experience with full-stack development, secure e-commerce integrations, and real-world problem-solving, all while contributing to a project with significant social value. Join us to build your skills, make a difference, and jumpstart your career in tech!

title: Azure Site Reliability Engineer
description:
**Join Our Team as an Azure Site Reliability Engineer:**

**Learn more about the position: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TaOIymqOjWQ**

Are you passionate about ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of software and infrastructure? Input 1 is seeking a seasoned Site Reliability Engineer to join our dynamic team. If you join us, you will collaborate closely with development, operations, and other cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain robust, automated solutions for managing our production environment. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in system administration, cloud technologies, and software engineering, along with a passion for solving complex technical challenges.

**About Us:**

Input 1 has a unique growth story, with its early beginnings as a family-built general agency in the 1950s. With unquestionable dedication to providing necessary and progressive solutions to an ever-evolving industry, Input 1 has since then grown to be a leading provider of software, payment, billing, and business process outsourcing solutions to the property and casualty insurance industry.

Choosing to work for Input 1 as an employee means choosing to work with really good people. Integrity, compassion, and respect are vital to the character of the people who work at our company. Knowledge, flexibility, and constant self-evaluation are drivers of our success. Our work environment rewards excellence, not egos.

**Responsibilities:**

* Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable, and efficient infrastructure and services in an Azure cloud environment.
* Develop and implement automation tools and processes to streamline deployment, monitoring, and management tasks.
* Perform UAT and Production software deployments.
* Collaborate with development teams to design applications for reliability, scalability, and performance.
* Monitor system performance and reliability metrics, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions to minimize downtime and improve performance.
* Participate in incident response and on-call rotation, identifying root causes of incidents and implementing preventive measures to mitigate future occurrences.
* Conduct regular reviews and audits of infrastructure and systems to identify potential areas for improvement and optimization.
* Assist with vulnerability scans, PCI scans, and emerging threats to protect the attack surface.
* Stay up to date with industry best practices, emerging technologies, and trends in site reliability engineering and cloud computing, and incorporate them into our practices and processes.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams to define and implement metrics and objectives to measure and improve system reliability and availability.
* Collaborate with security teams to ensure that infrastructure and services are designed and operated with security best practices in mind.

**Requirements:**

* Strong understanding of Windows systems administration and networking concepts.
* Experience with managing IIS, .Net, SQL Server environments.
* Hands-on experience with cloud computing platforms, Azure preferred.
* Proficiency and experience with scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell).
* Familiarity with monitoring and logging tools and incident management systems.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues in a distributed, high-availability environment.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Relevant Azure certifications are a plus.

**Education:**

* Desired Bachelor’s degree in computer science or comparable degree, or equivalent experience

**Experience/Knowledge:**

* 5+ years of experience in a similar role, with a focus on site reliability engineering, system administration, or software engineering.
* Experience working in SaaS environment.
* Competitive salary and benefits package.
* Salary of $110,000.00 - $150,000.00
* Competitive, based on experience.
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
* 401k
* 10 paid holidays
* Vacation/sick time.
